medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden cardiac death in a male infant at 9 weeks of age.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant was born after a normal pregnancy and initially demonstrated normal cardiovascular function. At 1 day old, he experienced recurrent episodes of sudden cyanosis and unconsciousness, which were associated with loud screams. An ECG revealed nonsustained runs of ventricular tachycardia. By day 5, a prolonged QTc interval of 600 ms was documented. The infant remained asymptomatic until 9 weeks old when he experienced a lethal tachyarrhythmia leading to death.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital long QT syndrome (LQTS); no significant health history prior to the fatal incident.
medical_history.family_history: The clinical examination of the family (parents and brother) was completely inconspicuous with no recorded episodes of tachycardia, syncope, or sudden unexpected deaths.
